From  offscreen we hear the sound of a shovel biting into earth We track laterally down the car, along the beam of its  headlights, to finally frame Ray as he climbs out of the  shallow grave he has just finished digging. He plants the shovel and walks back to the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The grave in the middle background; the car's headlights  beyond it. Ray is dragging Marty toward the grave. He dumps him in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Marty thumps to the bottom, face up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he bends over to pick up the shovel, dripping sweat. W hear the shovel biting into earth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray, in the foreground, pitches the first shovelful of ea onto Marty. Marty moves slightly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he pauses, looking down into the grave. He stoops down and resumes shoveling, bobbing in and out of frame as he  hurls dirt into the grave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Ray shovels, Marty is moving under the loose dirt. A f inarticulate noise comes from the grave. Almost imperceptibly, Marty's right arm starts to rise.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE GRAVE
dialogues.text: Ray stands on the lip of the grave, hunched over his shov crisply illuminated by the headlights. In the shadowy  foreground Marty's arm rises, extended toward Ray. He is  clutching Abby's gun in his splint-fingered hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he straightens up and stands motionless, expressionles watching Marty, making no attempt to get out of the way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gun extended into the foreground. His index finger  splinted, he slides his middle finger over the trigger of the gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gun trembling in the foreground. His knuckle whitens  over the trigger. The trigger releases and we hear the dull click of an emp chamber.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Staring blankly down at Marty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of Marty's gun hand as Ray slowly sinks down on the lip o the grave, bracing himself with the shovel. His hand reac for Marty's. Marty squeezes off two more empty chambers.  Ray's hand slowly closes over the barrel of the gun. As he pulls, the gun slides from Marty's fingers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Biting into the earth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Furiously shoveling dirt into the grave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marty barely visible under the dirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shoveling, panting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Half full.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Working furiously. His breath comes in short gasps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is filled. Ray is packing down the earth, slamming the shovel furiously against the bare patch of earth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Being slammed down against the earth. Again and again.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. OPEN FIELD SUNRISE
dialogues.text: The staccato beat of the shovel slamming against earth dr out at the cut. There is perfect quiet. The sun is just  peeping over the horizon. In the foreground Ray is sittin in the open door of his car, smoking a cigarette. His gaz is fixed on a spot offscreen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A house. Quite near by. The house and its perfect green rectangle of lawn are set incongruously in the middle of the open field.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO RAY
dialogues.text: Staring, without emotion. He takes one last, fierce drag on the cigarette, then fli it away. He takes the shovel, walks over to the grave and stares at it for several seconds, shovel clasped firmly i both hands. He walks back to the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: House, car and grave. Ray throws the shovel into the car, gets in, and turns the ignition. The engine coughs weakly and dies. He tries again. Same result. One more time. The engine coughs, sputters, and fires to  life. The car runs over the grave and rattles on across t rutted field towards the highway in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: INT. RAY'S CAR DAWN
dialogues.text: As Ray drives down the straight empty highway in the flat early-morning light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pale and unblinking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the distance we see a beat-up white station wagon  approaching. It's headlights wink on, then off again.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO RAY
dialogues.text: He squints at the approaching car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car is closer. It's headlights wink again.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO RAY
dialogues.text: His jaw tightens. He stares intently at the car. Then,  abruptly, he looks down at his dashboard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His headlights are on. Ray's hand enters frame and pushes the knob.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watching the approaching station wagon. As it passes we c a glimpse of its occupant. He grins and cocks a you-got-i finger at Ray before roaring out of frame.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The station hasn't opened yet. Ray's car, empty, stands a in the lot. Flat prairie stretches to the horizon. No mov in the frame. At the cut we hear the faint sound of a phone ringing thr a receiver. After four or five rings the phone is picked and we begin a slow crane down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (through phone;  sleepily) Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (present; very hoarsely) Abby... you all right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray?... What time is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. It's early... I love  you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...You all right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. I better get off now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The continuing crane down reveals Ray in a phone booth in the foreground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, see ya... Thanks, Ray.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abby--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The phone disconnects.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her sleeping head on a pillow. Offscreen we hear a door o and shut. A moment later Ray's dirt-caked hand comes into frame and gently brushes a wisp of hair back for Abby's f We hear Ray walk across the apartment and a moment later sound of water running. Abby stirs. She looks offscreen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Standing in the doorway to the bathroom. He is wiping his hands on a towel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sleepily) ...Ray?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still half asleep, Abby smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said you're bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a long pause. Finally:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling) ...You're bad too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray swings a chair out and sits down behind a table at th far end of the room. He leans back and props his legs up the table. He is staring across the room at Abby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're both bad.

dialogues.speaker: BLACK
dialogues.text: As we hear the click of a pull-string the camera is dropp down past an orange safe light, down the length of the st down to a metal darkroom tray where two short strips of  negative are burning. Visser's hand and yellow sleeve cuff (now orange) enter f with an 8 x 10 black-and-white photograph. The photograph dropped into the tray. As it burns we see that it is the  same picture of Abby's and Ray's "corpses" as Visser show Marty, except that in this print the bullet holes and blo are less convincingly brushed in. Another print is dropped into the tray and ignites. In th one we see bullet holes but no blood. A third print is dropped in and ignites. It is the origin undoctored shot of Abby and Ray asleep in bed. Visser's hands enter frame holding the picture-envelope t he took away from Marty's office. Visser rips it in half is about to drop it into the tray, but stops abruptly. There is posterboard, not a photograph, peeking out of th torn envelope. Visser's hands pull the two halves of the placard from th envelope and fit them together. The stenciled 8 x 10 plac says: "All Employees Must Wash Hands Before Resuming Work

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Staring at the placard in disbelief. After a moment his hand rises into frame to deposit a  cigarette in his mouth. His hand drops back down, groping a pocket. His hand jumps back into frame, empty; he thumps at his b pockets; he can't find his lighter. He wheels and exits frame. The light snaps off. A door sl shut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He has dozed off in his chair. Offscreen we hear a door s and his eyes open.

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: Emerging from the bathroom. Her voice has a flat echo in bare apartment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why didn't you get into bed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (groggy) I didn't think I could sleep. I'm  surprised you could. Are you all  right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She walks over and sits down on the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...You called me this morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abby looks at him, expecting more. Finally:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I just wanted to let you know  that everything was all right. I  took care of everything. Now all we  have to do is keep our heads.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray finally looks directly at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know about it, Abby. I went to the  bar last night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abby is looking at him in alarm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened?--Was Meurice there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He laughs shortly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...He didn't see me, though. Nobody  saw me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The chair grates back as he stands up and looks vaguely a the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Is it cold in here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abby is looking at him nervously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... what happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I cleaned it all up, but that ain't  important...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts nervously pacing around the room, looking for  something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...What's important is what we do  now; I mean we can't go around half- cocked. What we need is some time to  think about this, figure it out...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He moves a packing crate aside, still hunting around the  apartment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Anyway, we got some time now. But  we gotta be smart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abby, never point a gun at anyone  unless you're gonna shoot him. And  when you shoot him you better make  sure he's dead...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray's pacing is more agitated as he looks distractedly ar the apartment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...because if he's not dead he's  gonna get up and try and kill you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pauses, seemingly at a total loss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...That's the only thing they told  us in the service that was worth a  goddamn--Where the hell's my  windbreaker?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell happened, Ray?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray is walking to the window. Sunlight streams in around  him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That ain't important. What's important  is that we did it. That's the only  thing that matters. We both did it  for each other...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stoops down to look through a pile of clothes by the  window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...That's what's important.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what you're talking  about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray's head snaps around. Staring at her he slowly rises t his feet and then remains still.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I... I mean what're you talking about,  Ray? I haven't done anything funny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...What was that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abby, startled, can't contain her agitation anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (rapidly) Ray, I mean you ain't even acting  like yourself. First you call me at  five in the A.M. saying all kinds of  nice things over the telephone and  then you come charging in here scaring  me half to death without even telling  me what it is I'm supposed to be  scared of. I gotta tell you it's  extremely rattling.

dialogues.speaker: RAY
dialogues.text: We track toward him, isolating him against the window. He perfectly still. For a long time he can't speak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly) ...Don't lie to me, Abby--

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO ABBY
dialogues.text: Still worked up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How can I be lying if I don't even  know--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ring of the telephone cuts her off. She looks at the  phone, pauses for a moment, then continues, struggling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I mean if you and him had a fight  or something, I don't care, as long  as you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her voice trails off. The telephone won't stop ringing. Abby and Ray are starin at each other, seemingly oblivious to it. Finally:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Pick it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still ringing. Abby's hand enters frame and picks it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through the phone we hear only the rhythmic whir of a cei fan. Abby shifts the phone to her other ear, listening ha It is the same sound we heard earlier when she picked up phone at Ray's house. As before, the line clicks dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking at Ray) ...Welp, that was him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a long moment of silence. Then Ray's voice comes from across the room:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is silence again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray shifts in front of the window. He laughs humorlessly. The laugh stops abruptly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...What's going on with you two?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly) All right...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts across the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...You can call him back, whoever it  was...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is heading for the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I'll get out of your way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pauses at the foyer and pulls Abby's gun out of his po He sets it on a shelf by the door.

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: Watching. We hear the door open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You left your weapon behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear the door slam shut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear the rhythmic whir of the fan. We tilt down from t ceiling to reveal that we are in the living room of Ray's bungalow. In the foreground Visser sits in a chair with the cradled telephone in his lap, facing the front door, which stands open in the background. The contents of Abby's tote bag l strewn on the bureau next to Visser. Her purse is not the After a moment Visser rouses himself and starts to sweep articles back into the tote bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is dark, lit only by the morning light leaking in arou the drawn blinds. It is a small modern apartment such as sees in large apartment complexes--shag carpeting, built- bar. In the extreme foreground the small red "Power" ligh of a telephone answering machine glows in the darkness. The front door opens in the background, spilling bright  sunlight. Meurice stoops down, picks up two newspapers,  enters, and shuts the door. He walks toward the camera an his hand enters frame in extreme foreground to punch the  rewind button on the machine. His hand leaves frame. A fe pieces of mail are flipped down onto the machine table, p by piece, as the machine rewinds. He reaches down again a hits playback. After a beep:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi Meurice, this is Helene, Helene  Trend, and I'm calling 'cause I wanna  know just what the hell that remark  you made about Sylvia's supposed to  mean...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mail continues to flip down onto the table, piece by piec

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...She says you're full of shit and  frankly I believe her. And hey, I  love you too. Sure. Anyway, you better  call me soon because I'm going to  South America tonight--you know,  Uruguay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dial tone. Beep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (barking) Listen asshole, you know who this  is. I just got back from Corpus and  there's a lot of money missing from  the safe...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The mail stops dropping; Marty has Meurice's attention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I'm not saying you took it but  the place was your responsibility  and I told you to keep an eye on  your asshole friend. Don't--uh, don't  come to the bar tonight, I've got a  meeting. But tomorrow I want to have  a word with you, and with Ray--if  you can find him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dial tone. Beep. Meurice's hand drops into frame.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meurice, where the hell have you  been? I--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His finger presses the stop button.

dialogues.speaker: RAY'S FINGER
dialogues.text: Pressing into a dark stain in the upholstery of the back  seat of his car. When he raises it the fingertip is red-- seat still wet with blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looking down at the seat. He backs out of the car and wal up the driveway to his house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he comes through the screen door. It bangs shut behind him. As he crosses the living room we see, and he hears,  Meurice's Trans Am pulling up and stopping at the foot of the lawn. Ray turns and looks out the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray throws it open and hurriedly pulls out the first thin at hand--a sheet. We hear the door of the Trans Am open a slam shut.

dialogues.speaker: SHOT ON RAY
dialogues.text: Exiting the house as the screen door bangs and shudders b him. He hurries down the walk.

dialogues.speaker: SHOT RAY'S POV
dialogues.text: Meurice is rounding the bottom of the lawn and starting u the drive toward the incriminating car. Its back door is  standing ajar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope you're planning on leaving  town.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO RAY
dialogues.text: Reacting to the line as he reaches the car. He bends over throw the sheet over the seat just as Meurice walks up be him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (his back to Meurice;  arranging the sheet) Got a problem, Meurice?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you do, cowboy. You been to the  bar?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray is still hunched in the open doorway. He freezes  momentarily in arranging the sheet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You shouldn't have taken the money...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray doesn't reply or turn around. Meurice is getting more strident.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Look at me man, I'm serious. You  broke in the bar and ripped off the  safe...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray backs out of the car and turns around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Abby warned me you were gonna  make trouble. Trouble with you is,  you're too fucking obvious; the only  ones with the combination are me and  you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray looks evenly at Meurice. Behind him the sheet has bee arranged over the seat. He puts an unlit cigarette in his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and Abby. Maybe. But as far as  I'm concerned that only leaves one  fucking possibility.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (tonelessly) What's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meurice reaches out and swipes the unlit cigarette out of Ray's mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Those things are nothing but coffin  nails.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns and stares down the street, exasperated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Look. Personally I don't give a  shit. I know Marty's a hard-on but  you gotta do something. I don't know;  give the money back, say you're sorry,  or get the fuck out of here, or  something...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mow that his temper is gone, he realizes he has nothing m to say. He shakes his head and turns back down the drive, muttering as he lights himself Ray's cigarette.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...It's very humiliating, preaching  about this shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Standing in front of the back door of his car, watching  Meurice walk away. His right hand rises into frame to dep another unlit cigarette in his mouth. Offscreen, Meurice  calls from the end of the drive:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not laughing at this, Ray Bob,  so you know it's no fucking joke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear his car door slam. After a moment Ray exits frame heading for the house. The camera tracks slowly in to the back window of the car. Traces of blood are starting to seep up from the upholste into the sheet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are looking across the tiled floor toward the front  doorway. The room has the dim gray cast of daytime inside shuttered house. We hold on the empty foyer as we hear an intermittent high whining sound. We hear the padding of f on carpet, and then the clatter of nails on tile as Opal, Marty's German shepherd, trots into frame and circles the foyer, still whining. She jumps up and scratches desperat at the front door. A slow, rhythmic pounding is very faint on the track.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. MARTY'S BAR DUSK
dialogues.text: Abby has just gotten out of her car and is walking up to front of the darkened bar. The faint, rhythmic thumping  continues over the cut, its source somewhere offscreen. A Abby takes a key out of her purse and lets herself into t bar, the thumping stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abby switches on the lights, looks around, goes to the ba office door. Locked. As she fits her key into the lock:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly) Marty?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door swings open, fanning a shaft of light onto the  darkened room.

dialogues.speaker: MARTY'S OFFICE BATHROOM
dialogues.text: We are looking from the inside at the bathroom door that  won't close all the way. As the light fans into the offic beyond and seeps in through the crack of the bathroom doo we see Visser's sleeve cuff and his hand pressing against the door, to hold it near-shut.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO ABBY
dialogues.text: Standing in the office doorway. We pull her into the room She stops abruptly, looking past the camera, and wrinkles her nose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marty's fish, now half-decayed, still lie on the desk. Some of the desk drawers stand open, with some of their  contents strewn across the surface of the desk.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO ABBY
dialogues.text: She takes a step forward. We hear the crunch of glass  underfoot. She looks down at the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shards of broken glass lie on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO ABBY
dialogues.text: She looks up from the floor toward the back door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pane of the back-door window closest to the knob has  been shattered from the outside, scattering broken glass  into the office.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO ABBY
dialogues.text: She crosses slowly to the desk, staring at the rotted fis She looks up from the desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the standing safe behind the desk lies a white towel.  Abby's hand enters frame ans picks up the towel. In slow motion a hammer that's been wrapped inside slips of the towel, falls end-over-end, hits the floor with a d thud.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO ABBY
dialogues.text: Stooping down to pick up the hammer. At eye level as she  stoops down is the combination dial to the safe. The dial has been battered by the hammer. Abby looks from the hamm to the floor under the desk chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blood stains.

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: Staring down at the floor. She rises and looks at the des As she rises we hear glass under her feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dead fish. Beyond them, on the floor around the desk, broken glass.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO ABBY
dialogues.text: Staring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dead fish.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO ABBY
dialogues.text: She seems to be falling slowly backwards. The camera fall with her, keeping her in close shot. Her head hits a pill We pull back slowly to reveal that she is lying on the be in her apartment, staring across the room. She lies motio on the bad, her eyes wide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Across the darkened apartment we see the curtainless wind and beyond them, across the lamplit street, the facade of the opposite building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lying still. After a moment she gets out of bed, crosses the front door of the apartment, locks it, then walks  unsteadily back to the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She opens her eyes, lies still for a moment, coughs. She  gets out of bed and walks across the still dark apartment the bathroom. She shuts the bathroom door.

dialogues.speaker: BATHROOM
dialogues.text: Abby looks at herself in the mirror above the sink, then  turns on the tap water. From a neighboring apartment we h a dull rhythmic thumping on the wall. She pauses, listens for a moment, then starts to splash water on her face. From somewhere offscreen we hear the sharp sound of glass shattering. It reverberates for a moment, then dies. Abby looks up at the bathroom door. We hear a scraping at the  lock of her apartment door. Abby listens. Suddenly we hear the lock springing open, and the front d swinging on its hinges.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Startled. She shuts off the water and stands motionless.  Droplets of water are streaming down her face. We hear the sound of footsteps in the next room, crunchin across broken glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is no answer. After a moment we hear bedsprings cre in the next room. Abby opens the bathroom door and walks  out.

dialogues.speaker: MAIN ROOM
dialogues.text: A shaft of light slices across the floor from the open  bathroom door. Broken glass glints on the floor. In the s darkness we can see that someone is sitting on the bed. T person looks up. It is Marty. Abby recoils.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lover-boy oughta lock his door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abby looks nervously at Marty. Droplets of water are stil running down her face. She brushes one from her eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He smiles thinly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...That's a stupid thing to say,  right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abby takes a step back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I... I love you too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still smiling, Marty shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. You're just saying that because  you're scared...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stands. We hear glass under his feet. He unbuttons the middle button of his coat and reaches inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...You left your weapon behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He withdraws something from an inside pocket and tosses i to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As she catches the object. It is her compact.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks from her hands up to Marty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'll kill you too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marty gags, leans forward, doubles over to vomit--blood. The blood washes over the floor at his feet.

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: Bolts upright in bead with a muffled groan. Sweat pours d her face. She brushes a drop of sweat from her eye and lo around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moonlight glints through the windows across the hardwood  floor. Through the windows we can see the facade of the  opposite building. The apartment is dark and still, just we left it before she fell asleep.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO ABBY
dialogues.text: She slumps back onto the bed. One hand gropes down out of frame and comes up holding an illuminated alarm clock. Sh looks at it, drops it back to the floor. She turns on her side and stares across the room toward t window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is still not quite light. The few lights that shined i the windows of the opposite building before are now off; facade of the building is a flat, undetailed gray.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still lying on her side on the bed, her eyes open, starin at the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After a moment Abby enters frame. She picks her coat off chair and puts it on. We hear a car door slam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abby has just gotten out of her car in the foreground and crossing the lawn to the house. Down the road the street  lights are still on. One light burns in the house, in the window of Ray's bedroom. Abby approaches it.

dialogues.speaker: THROUGH THE WINDOW
dialogues.text: Over Abby's shoulder, as she leans against the sill of th open window and looks inside. Ray sits on the bed in the empty room, smoking a cigarett his profile to the window, gazing fixedly at the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray starts and looks toward the window, squinting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abby is coming through the screen door. The room is strik bare of everything except furniture. All personal effects have been removed. Abby looks around, bewildered, as Ray enters from the hal

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Where is everything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the trunk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abby, still standing in front of the door, looks at him  uncomprehendingly. Ray walks over to a couple of cardboar boxes stacked in the corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...In the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He ties a knot around the top carton with a piece of cord then cuts the cord with a collapsible fishing knife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...You leaving?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isn't that what you want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She slowly shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wanna come with me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He leans back against the boxes, watching her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...But first I gotta know what  happened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want to know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You broke into the bar. You wanted  to get your money. You and Marty had  a fight. Something happened...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray shakes his head, smiling. Abby squints at him, lookin for help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I don't know, wasn't it you? Maybe  a burglar broke in, and you found--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With your gun?...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He puts the knife in his pocket and walks over to the doo As he approaches her:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Nobody broke in, Abby. I'll tell  you the truth...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray faces Abby in front of the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Truth is, I've felt sick the last  couple of days. Can't eat... Can't  sleep... When I try to I... Abby...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's difficult to bring out. Ray's hand gropes for the cr slat on the screen door. Finally:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...The truth is... he was alive when  I buried him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abby stares. An object materializes in the sky beyond them. It is flip end-over-end in slow motion, moving toward Abby and Ray a the screen door. Abby and Ray, each staring at the other, fail to notice until-- THWACK--it bounces off the screen. Abby starts; Ray doesn't. The spell is broken, Abby pushes hesitantly at the screen door. Ray's hand slides off the cross-slat; he makes no m to stop her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Abby steps over the rolled-up newspaper that hit the s door.

dialogues.speaker: SHOT ON ABBY
dialogues.text: Hurrying down the driveway to get to her car. A low rumbl is building on the soundtrack. Abby glances at Ray's car she passes it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More blood has seeped into and dried on the dropsheet cov the back seat. The bass rumble grows louder, punctuated b rhythmic thumping.

dialogues.speaker: OVER ABBY'S SHOULDER
dialogues.text: As she pounds frantically on the door--the sound continui over the cut. After a moment the door edges open. Meurice is standing in the doorway in a long bathrobe. A  sleeper's blindfold is pushed up over his forehead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abby. What's the matter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I... I'm sorry, Meurice. I gotta  talk to you... Can I come in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks at her hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah... yeah, come in...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He steps aside to let her pass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...but I gotta tell ya...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Abby enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I'm retired.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meurice switches on a table lamp; the curtains are drawn  against the sun. Abby follows Meurice over to the bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, I got a hangover. Want a drink?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well I do...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pours himself a drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...For you I answer the door. If you  wanna stay here, that's fine. But  I'm retired.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something happened with Marty and  Ray--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sharply) Abby...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He glares at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Let me ask you one question...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He slams back the drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Why do you think I'm retired.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He grimaces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Ray stole a shitload of money  from Marty. Until both of 'em calm  down I'm not getting involved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No Meurice, it's worse than that.  Something really happened, I think  Marty's dead--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?! Did Ray tell you that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sort of...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meurice sits her down on the sofa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's total bullshit. Marty called  me after he was jacked up...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He tries to coax her into lying down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I mean, I don't know where he is,  but he ain't dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meurice--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't look too good. You sleep  last night?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her head meets an end cushion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meurice, you gotta help me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meurice rises from the sofa, sighs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right. Just sit tight. Try to  get some sleep...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He leans down to the table next to the sofa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I'll find Marty, find out what's  going on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her head on the cushion. We hear engine rumble. Abby twis her head back, following Meurice. As we hear the table la being switched off we:

dialogues.speaker: A CAR
dialogues.text: The engine rumble continues over the cut. There is no oth traffic on the highway. A light fog covers the road. A gr highway sign says: "San Antonio 73 mi." We hear a car rad playing softly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driving. He is gently lit by the light from the dashboard He reaches forward to turn off the radio. The only sound is the hum of the engine and the rhythmic clomping of tir on pavement. The look and sound of the scene are close to those of the first scene of the movie. Ray takes a cigarette out of his pocket and puts it in hi mouth, but leaves it unlit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The headlights of an approaching car materialize in the f The car passes with a roar. Up ahead a traffic light is turning amber.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO RAY
dialogues.text: The engine hum drops as he slows. We hear the low engine  rumble and the squeaking brakes of another car. Ray is no stopped in front of the deserted intersection. He looks u in his rearview mirror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another car is stopped just behind him, the fog floating past its headlights. The headlights halate in the fog; no of the rest of the car is visible.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO RAY
dialogues.text: The unlit cigarette still in his mouth. He looks down fro the rearview mirror to the intersection ahead of him. The is a long pause, during which we hear only the steady pur of Ray's car and the knocking rumble of the car behind hi Ray looks up at the traffic light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The light is just turning from red to green.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes his foot off the brake, hesitates for a moment, replaces it on the brake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks up in his rearview mirror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The headlights of the other car remain motionless behind  him. The car makes no move to pass.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO RAY
dialogues.text: He slowly takes the cigarette from his mouth and drops it onto the seat next to him. His eyes shift from the rearvi mirror to the traffic light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Green fog floats past the green light.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO RAY
dialogues.text: His face frozen. He turns slowly to look behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The other car is still motionless. We hear the muted rumb of its engine.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO RAY
dialogues.text: His eyes shift back to the mirror. He gropes for his wind handle and slowly rolls it down. He sticks out his left a eyes still on the rearview mirror, and waves for the othe car to go around him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The other car remains still for a moment. White fog float up beyond the red fog created by Ray's brake lights. Finally the car pulls out slowly to the left to pass.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO RAY
dialogues.text: Watching the car pass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the car pulls out into the light from the intersection and Ray's headlights, we see that it is a battered green  Volkswagon. First the car itself, and then its red tail  lights, disappear into the fog.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO RAY
dialogues.text: Watching, for a long moment. Finally he takes his foot off the brake, turns the steeri wheel hard left and hangs a U-turn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A light is switched on in the expensively appointed room. Meurice enters, walking silently on the carpet, looking a the room. He throws the light off at the far end and leav

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door swings open.  Meurice throws the switch near the door and the room is bathed in light. We are once again i the bedroom where we earlier saw Abby looking through her purses. We start to hear the faint buzzing of a fly. Meurice glances around, throws off the light, and shuts t door. Black.

dialogues.speaker: MARTY'S OFFICE
dialogues.text: Somewhere offscreen a light is switched on and we are loo in close shot at the dead fish. The sound of the fly is louder with the cut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Standing in the doorway from the bar, staring down at the fish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray glances around at the broken glass lying on the floor His gaze shifts to the safe and the hammer in front of it He walks over to the safe and stoops down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He works its battered dial and it swings open. He shuffle through the contents and brings out a small pile of  photographs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he flips through the photographs. The first four are R and Abby in the motel room bed. The last is a mounted 8 x 10: Abby and Marty on a Gulf beach.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO RAY
dialogues.text: Looking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marty is still laughing.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO RAY
dialogues.text: He scowls at the shots Visser took, then puts them back i the safe. When his hand comes out he is holding another  photograph--this one folded twice. He unfolds it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His and Abby's corpses.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO RAY FROM ACROSS THE DESK
dialogues.text: As he straightens slowly from the safe in the background. At desk level, we again see the glint of Visser's lighter under the dead fish. Ray crosses slowly around the desk into the foreground an lays the picture flat on the desktop. For a moment he sta down at it, then wheels abruptly and leaves frame.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driving. He glances up in the rearview mirror.

dialogues.speaker: MARTY'S KITCHEN
dialogues.text: As Meurice enters and throws an overhead light. The white room is bathed in bright, shadowless light. As Meurice st into the kitchen his foot strikes something on the floor  below frame, which clatters hollowly away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The empty bowl skids into a wall, bounces back, and wobbl spinning on its bottom rim.

dialogues.speaker: SHOT TOWARD MOUNTED MOOSE HEAD
dialogues.text: On a low skewed axis the camera is tracking in toward the impassive trophy head on Marty's billiard-room wall. The moose still has Ray's cigarette protruding from its m

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he walks toward the moose, head cocked to one side,  frowning quizzically up. He hears something, and looks through the door to his lef

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The long shadowy hall. We hear panting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Squinting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Opal?

dialogues.speaker: THE HALLWAY
dialogues.text: A form starts to materialize in the shadows.

dialogues.speaker: MEURICE
dialogues.text: Taking a step back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dog bounding down the hallway. Its panting has become low growl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wrenches a cue stick from the rack and squares.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Opal snarling, leaping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The splintered top half of the pool cue is slammed down t rest on top of the coffee table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even the fucking dog's gone crazy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sitting on the sofa, looking down out of frame. Behind he Meurice agitatedly paces back and forth, waving the splin bottom half of the cue stick. His voice is unnaturally lo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Something pretty fucking weird is  going on. Put your coat on and I'll  drop you at home. But don't talk to  either of 'em until I do. And don't  worry. Believe me. These things always  have a logical explanation. Usually.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The splintered top half of the cue stick on the coffee ta

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abby approaches her door in the foreground and lets herse in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looking toward the window. The room is dark. Through the  window we see the facade of the building across the stree Abby enters frame in the foreground, in silhouette agains the window, and throws an overhead light switch. The brig light reveals Ray standing by the window, looking out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (abruptly) Turn it off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abby jumps, startled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From the roof of the building across the street we are lo down on the facade of Abby's building. Most of its window are dark, but in a brightly lit fourth-floor window we ca clearly see Abby and Ray. A man is on the roof in the foreground, hitching a rifle his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray turns from the window which, with the switching on of the overhead light, has become a mirror of the interior o the apartment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just turn it off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The light goes out in the apartment across the street; it window goes opaque.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dark now. Ray still stands by the window, looking out. Ab still stands by the light switch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (answering a question) No curtains on the windows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abby is clearly apprehensive--about Ray, not about anythi outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think someone's watching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abby doesn't understand, and has had enough. As she throw the light back on:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what'll they see?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray turns angrily from the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just leave it off. He can see in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray and Abby are once again clearly visible. Ray is start across the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abby takes a fearful step back as Ray strides toward the  light switch, next to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (abruptly) --If you do anything the neighbors'll  hear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This brings Ray up short. He stares at Abby. It registers that it is him she's afraid of.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Abby. I meant it... when I  called...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abby takes another step back. Her voice comes out, after pause, half-strangled:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I love you too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray winces. He slowly shakes his head with a pained half- smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because you're scared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear the dull report of a rifle and the deafening soun of shattering glass. The gun shot hits Ray in the back,  knocking him to the floor. He lies still.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stares dumbly down at Ray. She looks slowly up to the window.

dialogues.speaker: THE WINDOW
dialogues.text: It has a gaping black hole. The sound of shattering glass still reverberates in the apartment. Small shards of glas chink down from the window and shatter on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO ABBY
dialogues.text: Staring at the window, paralyzed--almost in a trance. Qui except for the chinking of glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are looking through the telescopic sight of a high-pow rifle. The rifle sweeps up from Ray's body across the bri lit room, and centers Abby, still staring at the window, the cross hairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are looking past Abby toward the shattered window at t far end of the room. A brass lamp stands in the foregroun between Abby and the camera. Abby still stands paralyzed. Glass has stopped chinking from the window to the floor;  there is a painful silence. Suddenly Abby dives to the floor just as CRASH the rest o the window falls away and PING the brass lamp somersaults toward us from the impact of the bullet. The window is now completely gone--just a black hole in t brightly lit wall.

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: Scrambles into a corner at the window end of the room. Th only sound is her heavy breathing. She looks over at Ray, then up at the bulb on the ceiling.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO ABBY
dialogues.text: Breathing heavily, almost hysterical. She looks down at t floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray is sprawled on the floor in a pool of blood and broke glass.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO ABBY
dialogues.text: She reaches down and pulls off one of her shoes. She thro it at the ceiling bulb. We hear the bulb shatter and the room goes black. Abby rises and makes her way cautiously across the glass- littered floor toward Ray. She stoops over him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Its front door in background. Abby rises into frame and b toward the doorway, staring down at the floor. One of her hands is covered with blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She winces and almost loses her balance as we hear a piec of glass crunching under her bare floor. She turns and mo to the front door, favoring one foot, and throws the door open.

dialogues.speaker: HALLWAY
dialogues.text: Abby lurches from her apartment and pounds on the neighbo door. No answer. She pounds on the door across the hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (frightened, in Spanish) Get away! I'll call my son-in-law!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (groping for the words,  in Spanish) No no--you don't understand--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Spanish) He has a gun!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abby heads for the stairway at the far end of the hall. T heel of her shod foot is throwing her weight onto her bad foot; she kicks off the shoe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As she reaches the top of the stairs. She takes one step  down, then brings herself up short. She looks over the ra down the stairwell. It is quiet. An innocent-sounding cou echoes somewhere in the building. We hear the sound of footsteps from somewhere below. Abby turns and hobbles back to her apartment. The barenes of the hallway sets off her abandoned shoe.

dialogues.speaker: ABBY'S APARTMENT
dialogues.text: As she enters and slams the door behind her. She scrabble at the lock, finally manages to get it shut, then turns a looks frantically around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray is lying still in the darkness. We can hear footsteps approaching up the hallway. Abby enters frame and kneels down next to Ray. She fumble around him briefly in the darkness. The doorknob rattles. Abby freezes, listening, trying to  control her breath. After a moment we hear a scraping at lock. Abby moves to the bathroom adjoining the main room and sh the door behind her.

dialogues.speaker: BATHROOM
dialogues.text: It is very small. Abby presses her palms against the door and slowly eases her ear against the door to listen. The  scraping in the apartment door lock continues. Sweat stre down Abby's face. She brushes a drop from her eye. We hear the snap of the lock springing open, and the fron door swinging on its hinges.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her ear pressed to the door. From the next room we hear t sound of footsteps crunching across broken glass. Abby backs away from the door, stares at it, then turns a moves to the bathroom window. She looks out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sheer drop to the narrow backyard of the building four  stories below. Next to Abby's window is another window,  separated from hers only by the breadth of the wall, that separates the two apartments.

dialogues.speaker: ABBY'S APARTMENT
dialogues.text: Visser hunches, hands on knees, over Ray, who lies on the floor out of frame.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grimly) All right...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hunkers down closer to Ray.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...You got some of my personal  property.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is rummaging through Ray's pockets but comes up empty- handed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...One of you does.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Visser looks down at Ray, glances around the room, looks  back down at Ray.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I don't know what the hell you  two thought you were gonna pull.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His hand, gripping something, flashes down out of frame. hear a dull crunch.

dialogues.speaker: BATHROOM
dialogues.text: Abby has drawn her head back from the bathroom window. Sh moves back to the door and braces herself against it.

dialogues.speaker: ABBY'S APARTMENT
dialogues.text: Visser straightens up from Ray's body. He drops something the floor, out of frame, that lands with a thud. He goes over to the light switch on the wall and flips it back and forth. No light. He goes over to the brass lamp, sets it upright, tries it switch. Again nothing. He disappears into the kitchenette as we hold on its open doorway. After a moment we hear a refrigerator hum as a c blue light plays in the doorway. There is the rattle of a can being pulled off the refrigerator rack, and the snap its pull-tab being opened. After a couple of audible slur we hear the can go back on the rack and, as the blue ligh disappears, we hear the refrigerator door close. Visser reappears in the doorway. He surveys the room, fix on the bathroom door, goes over, turns the knob. The door swings open. He walks in.

dialogues.speaker: BATHROOM
dialogues.text: Visser looks around the cramped space. The shower curtain drawn. He casually draws it back. The shower is empty. He goes to the window and leans out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sheer drop below; the other window to one side.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO VISSER
dialogues.text: He draws his head back in, presses his palms against the  adjacent wall, and eases his ear to the wall to listen. Perfect quiet. After a moment he goes back to the window, braces himself against the sash, and sticks his arm out--groping for the window of the adjacent apartment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pressing against the glass as he leans against the upper  half of the bathroom window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It finds the adjacent window and starts to raise it.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO VISSER'S FACE
dialogues.text: Again we see him through the window. His jaw is set as he gropes offscreen. Suddenly his body jerks violently forward, his head smack against the glass and cracking it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abby (out of frame) has grabbed it and now THUMP she slam the window down on his wrist, catching it between the win sash and sill. Her other hand flashes across frame to THUNK pin Visser's hand to the sill with Ray's knife.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO VISSER
dialogues.text: We hear the shatter of glass as the shock causes his head break through the window. His hand is nailed into the  apartment next door. He is in pain.

dialogues.speaker: ADJACENT APARTMENT
dialogues.text: Abby back slowly from the window, staring at the hand. Fr the ground below we hear the faint and echoing sounds of shards of glass shattering against pavement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Visser's pinned hand is writhing. As we hear a muffled CRACK, a circle of light opens with puff of plaster dust in the wall that separates the two  apartments. A line of light shoots across the dark apartm from the bright bathroom next door.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO ABBY
dialogues.text: Staring at the wall. We hear a second CRACK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A second hole has opened in the wall, letting through a s shaft of light. Four more sharp reports in rapid succession: With each gu blast a bright circle opens and a new shaft of light  penetrates the dark apartment. Finally we hear the CLICK of an empty chamber, and the cl of the empty gun being dropped to the floor of the bathro next door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Staring at the lines of light that crisscross the apartme There is a long moment of silence, then a sudden THUMP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Six circles of light. The circles go black momentarily as there is another THUM And another. Each time Visser pounds his fist against the wall, there is a muffled THUMP and his swinging arm strob the bullet holes.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO ABBY
dialogues.text: She turns and hobbles toward the door of apartment. The  muffled thumping continues, as in her dream.

dialogues.speaker: HALLWAY
dialogues.text: As Abby emerges from the adjacent apartment. She stops an looks down the hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The stairway is at the far end of the hall. The door of h own darkened apartment stands slightly ajar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bullet holes strobing. The pounding, more purposeful  now, grows louder and more intense. Finally, with a crash, Visser's fist penetrates the wall an explosion of light and dust.

dialogues.speaker: HALLWAY
dialogues.text: We pull Abby as she limps hesitantly down the hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Waving aimlessly through the ambient dust. He is blindly  groping for the sill--and the knife that pins his other h His outstretched middle finger just grazes the handle of knife.

dialogues.speaker: ABBY'S HALLWAY / APARTMENT
dialogues.text: Pulling Abby as she draws even with the door of her apart

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her pearl-handled revolver sits on the shelf just inside door, where Ray left it. It catches the light from the ha

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The side of his middle finger rubs against the knife hand the tip of his index finger barely touches it. Visser's  fingers are trembling, indicating that his arm is stretch to its uttermost. A surge against the wall gives his fingers another inch o so and they curl around the handle of the knife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As she steps in from the hallway to pick up the gun. She  looks around the apartment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The window of the apartment, its glass now completely gon lets in streetlight. Ray's corpse is a dark form in the m of the floor. A bright shaft of light slices across the r from offscreen. It glints on the shards of glass that lit the floor, just as in Abby's dream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he slowly, quietly draws his hand in from the hole in wall. He is holding the knife. He turns slowly to face the door, listening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She steadies herself against the wall and turns to look t the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bathroom door stands slightly ajar. The interior of t bathroom is a bright band in the shadowy recesses of the  back of the apartment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moving quietly toward the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Staring, almost transfixed, at the bathroom door. She rai the gun, trembling, and trains it on the band of light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Visser's shadow falls across the crack in the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO ABBY
dialogues.text: She shifts the gun slightly and fires.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With the roar of the gun, a small circle of light opens i the door. As the door waffles under the impact, we hear V collapsing behind it.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO ABBY
dialogues.text: Leaning against the facing wall. She lowers the gun. She  slides down the wall to finally rest seated on the floor. She brushes a drop of sweat from her eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cracked bathroom door spilling light.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO ABBY
dialogues.text: A pause. After a moment, her voice comes out half-choked:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I ain't afraid of you, Marty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bathroom door. Quiet for a long moment. Then, from inside the bathroom, we hear laughter.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO ABBY
dialogues.text: Staring at the door. We hear the laughter subside, to lea the sound of labored breathing. Finally:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Well ma'am...

dialogues.speaker: BATHROOM
dialogues.text: Visser lies on his back, his head underneath the bathroom sink. His good hand is pressed against his belly, which rises a falls with his heavy breathing. Blood seeps out between h fingers. He is smiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...If I see him, I'll sure give him  the message.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The underside of the sink, its convoluted chrome works be moisture.

dialogues.speaker: VISSER
dialogues.text: Looking, with mild interest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A condensed droplet trickles down the chrome. Directly overhead, it hangs for a moment from the lowest  joint of the pipe. It fattens, wavers, wavers--and falls, spelling... FINIS. [DELETED SCENE FROM 1st. DRAFT]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "...In an early draft of the script, Ray, the befuddled  bartender who for want of a more compelling character ser as our story's hero, fled the scene of the tale's protrac central murder and checked into a motel outside of San  Antonio:"

dialogues.speaker: MOTEL LOBBY DAY
dialogues.text: DUSTY RHODES, a lean man with a weathered face and large  Adam's apple, stands behind the Formica check-in counter. KYLE, a heavyset man of thirty wearing a feed cap, sits i the lobby's one piece of furniture, a beat-up leatherette sofa. He sips from a can of soda. Ray, begrimed and haggard, enters out of the glare of the noonday sun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey there, stranger! What can I do  you for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need a room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calling out from the divan:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He needs a room, Dusty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I reckon I can hear him... (to Ray) ...Room rate's eight sixty-six a day  plus sales tax, plus extra for the  TV option.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much extra?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling out) He wants the TV option, Dusty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I reckon I can hear him. TV option,  that's a dollar twenty, makes nine  eighty-six plus tax.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling out) Tell him the channels, Dusty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Channels, we got two and six. Two  don't come in so hot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just a room then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling out) He don't want the option, Dusty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I reckon I heard the man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after shooting Kyle  an irritated glance) Does he work here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling out) Sure don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See, Wednesday's the special on RC  Cola. I don't know if I explained  about the TV option. If there's a TV  in the room, you got to pay the  option.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling out) And how many room got TV, Dusty?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ever durned one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gamely) Okay, I'll take the TV option.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well see the thing about that is,  we're booked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Looking at this scene now, years later, it strikes us th revising it out of existence, as we did, constituted too  much rewriting. Indeed, the more prosaic scene we replace it with, involving Ray stopped at a traffic light, can be found in the finished script but not in the finished movi It was shot but then deleted in order to more quickly get the carnage, which was the picture's raison d'^etre..." JOEL & ETHAN COEN
